page.title: 06HIGHEAD CASTLE
page.content: Situated in the area of Inglewood Forest. The Norman Kings' love of hunting brought about laws designed to protect forests and to conserve deer. Highead Castle was built to protect the King's interests in the 13th century and was the home of The Keeper of the Castle and Forest. Since the 13th century there have been periods of decline and expansion but since a serious fire in the 1940's there has been continued decline leading to a possible demolition of what was once in this area the pre- eminent Georgian mansion.
